label: Research in Geography
description: Detailed examination and discussion of the methods of initiating and executing research projects in human or physical geography (taught in separate sections); requires students to write a research proposal of a quality suitable for a graduate thesis. 2 undergraduate hours. 2 graduate hours. Prerequisite: GEOG 471; either graduate standing in geography or senior standing as a geography major and consent of department.
courseSectionInformation: 2 undergraduate hours. 2 graduate hours. Prerequisite: GEOG 471; either graduate standing in geography or senior standing as a geography major and consent of department.
sectionRegistrationNotes: Restricted to students with Senior or Graduate class standing.
sectionDeptRestriction: Restricted to students in the Geography & Geographic InfoSci department.
